Requirements:
To be admitted to the university, first-year applicants must submit a completed online application, a non-refundable application fee, and an official high school transcript. An essay is also required as part of the application. Submission of SAT or ACT scores is optional.

To be admitted to the Belk College of Business Upper Division and continue in the Accounting major, students must first be admitted to UNC Charlotte, complete a minimum of 45 semester hours, and have a cumulative GPA of at least 2.5. Students must also complete the following courses with a grade of C or better: ACCT 2121, ACCT 2122; ECON 2101, ECON 2102; MATH 1120 or MATH 1241; STAT 1220, STAT 1221, or STAT 1222; and INFO 2130.

Students can declare a minor in Actuarial Mathematics by meeting with an advisor in the Department of Mathematics and Statistics. Students must complete MATH 1241, MATH 1242, and MATH 2241 or equivalents to begin the coursework for the Actuarial Mathematics Minor.

Requirements:
Our holistic review process considers your academic performance in high school, including your GPA and the rigor of your coursework, as well as your standardized test scores (if you choose to submit them), and your personal essay. In order to be eligible for admission to the UNC System, you must meet the Minimum Course Requirements (MCR) as established by the UNC Board of Governors.

Minimum Course Requirements:
- 4 units of English
- 4 units of mathematics (including algebra I, geometry, algebra II, and a fourth-level math course beyond algebra II)
- 3 units of science (including a life science, a physical science, and a lab)
- 2 units of social science (including one unit of U.S. history)
- 2 additional units from English, mathematics, science, social studies, world languages, or computer science

The Minor in Biology consists of 18-19 credit hours. At least 9 credit hours must be taken at UNC Charlotte. All courses must be passed with a grade of C or above. A GPA of at least 2.0 in the minor is required.

Requirements: The Business Administration minor is open only to non-business majors. Students must have a minimum overall GPA of 2.5 and have completed 30 semester hours of coursework to declare this minor. All minor courses must be completed with a grade of C or above.

UNC Charlotte requires a high school diploma or its equivalent and the successful completion of a minimum of 16 units of college preparatory work. At a minimum, this coursework should include:

- 4 units of English
- 4 units of mathematics (including a fourth math beyond Algebra II)
- 3 units of science (including one life science, one physical science and one lab)
- 2 units of social science (including one U.S. history)
- 2 units of the same foreign language

The minor in criminal justice and criminology requires 18 credit hours of criminal justice and criminology coursework. Nine of the 18 credit hours must be taken at UNC Charlotte. All courses must be completed with a grade of C or better.

Requirements: Our holistic review process is designed to help us get to know you as a whole person, not just your test scores or GPA. We seek to admit students who will succeed academically, get involved and enhance our vibrant campus community. A completed application includes: Application, Non-refundable application fee, Official high school transcript, and Official SAT or ACT scores (optional for 2024 admissions).

The requirements for a Minor in Mathematics are 18 credit hours of mathematics courses as specified below. A grade of C or above is required in each course counted for the minor. 

Required Courses (12 credit hours):
- MATH 1241 - Calculus I
- MATH 1242 - Calculus II
- MATH 2241 - Calculus III
- MATH 2164 - Matrices and Linear Algebra

Elective Courses (6 credit hours):
- Two additional MATH courses at the 3000-level or above.

For first-year admission, applicants must submit a completed application and fee, an official high school transcript, and standardized test scores (SAT/ACT). However, UNC Charlotte is test-optional for students applying for admission through Fall 2024. A personal essay is a recommended component of the application.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering

Requirements: UNC Charlotte practices a comprehensive and holistic review process that considers the following: rigor of academic coursework, academic performance (GPA), and extracurricular activities (leadership, service, work experience, etc.). An essay is also required as part of the application.
Program name: Bachelor of Arts in Middle Grades Education

Requirements: The minor in Military Science is open to all University students in good academic standing who are U.S. citizens and meet the physical standards for admission to the Basic Course.
A student wishing to declare a Minor in Music must meet with a music advisor in the Department of Music. The minor is available to any student who meets the general requirements for a minor.

Admission to the Department of Music requires an audition for the department in addition to the application to the University. General university application requirements include an application form, an application fee, and an official high school transcript. Submission of SAT or ACT scores is optional. The personal essay is a recommended item. The supplemental application to the Department of Music requires a music résumé.

Admission to the Department of Music is a dual-admission process. Students are required to be admitted to both the University and the Department of Music. Acceptance by the University does not guarantee acceptance by the department. Auditions and interviews are required for all students seeking admission as majors and minors in the Department of Music.
Program name: Bachelor of Music in Music Education

Requirements:
All prospective music majors and minors must complete a two-part application process:

1. Apply to UNC Charlotte by the admissions deadlines.
2. Apply to the Department of Music. This involves submitting an online music application and scheduling an audition.

You must be accepted by both the University and the Department of Music to become a music major or minor.
Program name: Bachelor of Music in Music Performance

Requirements: Admission to the BSN program is a two-phase process. Phase I is admission to the University as a Pre-Nursing Student through the University Office of Undergraduate Admissions. General first-year application requirements include an online application and fee, official high school transcript, and a short essay. Standardized test scores (SAT/ACT) are optional. Phase II is the competitive application to the Upper Division of the nursing program. Requirements for the Upper Division application include completion of a separate School of Nursing application, completion of a minimum of 45 of the 59 required lower division semester hours, a minimum GPA of 3.0 in all lower division coursework, successful completion of the Test of Essential Academic Skills (TEAS), and completion of Certified Nurse Aide (CNA I) training and listing on a state registry.

In order to complete your application, you must submit the following: Online Application; $80 Application Fee; Official High School Transcript; SAT or ACT Scores. We also require an essay as a part of the application for admission.

The Minor in Russian Studies consists of 18 credit hours beyond the 1202 level. All minors must complete RUSS 2210 and RUSS 2211 or the equivalent. The remaining 12 hours may include courses in Russian at the 2000 level and above, and related courses offered in other departments (when a substantial portion of the work is devoted to Russian and/or East European topics). A grade of C or above is required in all courses counting toward the minor. Students must complete a minimum of 9 credit hours at UNC Charlotte.

Requirements: Admission to UNC Charlotte is based on a holistic review. A complete first-year application requires a completed online application, a non-refundable application fee, and an official high school transcript. For spring 2024, fall 2024, and spring 2025 admission, first-year students have the option to have their application reviewed with or without standardized test scores (SAT or ACT). Requirements: First-year applicants must submit an online application, a non-refundable application fee, and an official high school transcript. Official college transcripts are required if any college coursework has been completed. The submission of SAT or ACT scores is optional.

Students who wish to declare a minor in Statistics must have a grade of C or above in either STAT 1220, STAT 1221, or STAT 1222 and an overall GPA of 2.0 or above. Students who do not meet these requirements can seek an exception from the department.

The Minor in Systems Engineering requires 18 credit hours. A grade of C or above is required in all courses for the Minor. Required Courses (12 credit hours): SEGR 2100 - Introduction to Systems Engineering (3), SEGR 2200 - Systems Engineering Design Tools I (3), SEGR 3100 - Systems Engineering Design Tools II (3), SEGR 3200 - Systems Engineering Design Project (3). Electives (6 credit hours): Choose 6 credit hours from the following: SEGR 4991 - Systems Engineering Topics (3), SEGR 4992 - Systems Engineering Topics (3), SEGR 4993 - Systems Engineering Topics (3), SEGR 4994 - Systems Engineering Topics (3), SEGR 4995 - Systems Engineering Topics (3).
